text:
You, sir, have been watched by me overtime and... You certainly have a very special taste in music. Said that, this game would be my first on the Vita. But not only this, such a theme sounds so... Classical, in a good sense. It feels like in a theater, watching an orchestra play!
You've found a pearl.

author: Vector

text:
Bought a vita for Persona 4 and since I'm a Playstation Plus subscriber I get to play this game for free.
It really is incredible. The feeling you have dashing through the rooftops then stopping in midair at the touch of a button is amazing.
Wouldn't say it's a system seller because it looks like a short game from what I've played, though.
author: Thomas Carollo

text: I bought a Vita just for Persona 4 Golden and it was totally worth it. This will probably be the next Vita game I get, but I have to finish sinking 100+ hours into P4G first.
author: swoosh870

text: It's too bad the Vita doesn't have a large number of ultra high qualty games for it, because I played the demo, and this game is an absolute blast from the 5 minutes I touched of it. But I'm not too sure about buying a system for just 1 game. Usually when I do that it's with knowledge of interest in other games and large support for the system. But the Vita just seems to lack that support.

text: Oh wow, wonderful pick SD! I had this as one of my favorite songs from 2012, absolutely amazing orchestration here. Just brings a smile to my face and happy you listened to it and wanted it to give some play time. I bought a Vita recently and this was the first game I got for it and it's a hell of a launch game. P4 the golden and Ragnarok Odyssey are next on my list. Oh and you might want to give Soundshape a listen, some amazing music in that from the Vita as well.

author: Delarius

text: This game alone made my Vita a worthy purchase. All of the music is fantastic, the design and graphics are really pretty, the gameplay is fun (though the combat could use some fine-tuning), overall this is a fantastic game. Anyone who owns a PS Vita should buy this game asap. Here's hoping for Gravity Rush 2 :D
author: CaptainFawfulll

text: If you have to choose between 3ds and vita, get the 3ds.  The vita is a waste of money right now.  And yes this track is awesome.
author: Matt 6418

text:
I bought a Vita and beat Gravity Rush a couple days back. I bought the DLC too, and all I can say is that this is a new favorite-of-all-time list placer. The visuals and gameplay mechanics are sublime. The story is alright, however if you don't play the DLC missions before the end of the game, the regular ending makes little to no sense (because certain characters in the end are introduced in the DLC). 

Get this, P4G and MGS to really enjoy the Vita. Fantastic game!

author: princedraco5

text: Probably the first game I'd play if I had a Vita. I've had this theme stuck in my head for a while now, it's beautiful. It sounds like it could play in an anime, during a peaceful opening or a nice scene. Tanaka composed for a lot of animes so that's not too surprising. He also composed for games like Paladin's Quest 1&2 and﻿ Alundra. And now with this soundtrack, I'm officially a big fan of his.
author: SupraDarky
